metadata.title: CVE-2021-4209 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in GnuTLS. As Nettle's hashupdate functions internally call memcpy, providing zero-length input maycause undefined behavior. This flaw leads to a denial of service afterauthentication in rare circumstances.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4209` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1
guile-gnutls - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1
libgnutls30 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1').
